@graph.name: How to Set Up Payment Gateways on Shopify
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to configure payment options in Shopify Admin

step.name: Access Payment Settings
step.text: Go to Shopify Admin → Settings → Payments

step.name: Choose Payment Provider
step.text: Choose Shopify Payments or select a third-party provider

step.name: Configure Account Details
step.text: Enter account details and configure authorization settings

step.name: Enable Alternative Methods
step.text: Enable alternative methods (BNPL, PayPal, or crypto)

step.name: Test Transactions
step.text: Test transactions before making it live

mainEntity.name: Can I use multiple payment gateways simultaneously on my Shopify store?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. You can enable multiple payment options like Shopify Payments, PayPal, and Klarna at the same time.

mainEntity.name: What happens if a customer's payment fails during checkout?

acceptedAnswer.text: A failed payment may appear as a pending charge on the customer's card and typically disappears within 3-5 business days.

mainEntity.name: Can I customize the checkout experience based on the payment method?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. Shopify Plus users can create custom payment extensions to add extra checkout fields or redirect payments.

mainEntity.name: Is it possible to enable cryptocurrency payments on Shopify?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. Use Coinbase Commerce or BitPay to accept Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies.
